intro: Echinops afghanicus, commonly known as the Afghan thistle, is a flowering plant native to Afghanistan and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its spiky, spherical seed heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to dry climates. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The hardy nature of Echinops afghanicus makes it a resilient plant in challenging ecological conditions.
